title: Ping in LAN Higher than Neighbor
body: I live in FL and get about 45 ping on NA servers (same as my neighbor) but when we play on LAN server, which are in miami, he gets 13 ping while i get almost 70. Why is this and how can I fix it?

replies.body:
The main reason that's happening is probably due to your two connections taking different routes to the LAN servers. To find out for sure, have you and your friend run a traceroute to that server (66.151.33.248) using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and compare the results. 

My first step in trying to get that ping lowered would probably be adjusting my DNS settings to googles to see if that would get me a better route to the LAN servers. Give that a shot following the steps in the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) if you aren't familiar with DNS settings, and let me know if that helps or not!
